p:
Invasive non-typhoidal Salmonella (iNTS) disease is principally caused by serovars S. Typhimurium and S. Enteritidis and is thought to be responsible for up to 680,000 deaths annually, with Africa accounting for more than half of cases
1 . Much of this burden is in children under 5 years and HIV-infected adults. In view of this major global burden of disease, and rapid emergence of multidrug resistant iNTS strains
2 , development of a vaccine is increasingly vital
3 .
